metadata.title: CVE-2020-25285 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
A race condition between hugetlb sysctl handlers in mm/hugetlb.c in theLinux kernel before 5.8.8 could be used by local attackers to corruptmemory, cause a NULL pointer dereference, or possibly have unspecifiedother impact, aka CID-17743798d812.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-25285` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-193-generic - 4.4.0-193.224
linux-image-4.4.0-193-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-193.224
linux-image-4.4.0-193-lowlatency - 4.4.0-193.224
linux-image-4.4.0-193-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-193.224
linux-image-4.4.0-193-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-193.224
linux-image-4.4.0-193-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-193.224
linux-image-4.4.0-193-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-193.224
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-193-generic - 4.4.0-193.224
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-193-lowlatency - 4.4.0-193.224
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-126-generic - 4.15.0-126.129~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-126-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-126.129~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-126-lowlatency - 4.15.0-126.129~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-126-generic - 4.15.0-126.129~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-126-lowlatency - 4.15.0-126.129~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1082-kvm - 4.4.0-1082.91
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1117-aws - 4.4.0-1117.131
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1088-aws - 4.15.0-1088.93~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1100-azure - 4.15.0-1100.111~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1088-gcp - 4.15.0-1088.101~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1059-oracle - 4.15.0-1059.65~16.04.1
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-193.224').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-126.129~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1082.91').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1117.131').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1088.93~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1100.111~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1088.101~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1059.65~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1141.151').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1145.155').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-fips package in fips/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
